attributes.action:
Save Lives
End Covid 19
Save the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
Current strategies will only lead to loss of lives and extended isolation
Prof Chris Whitty the government’s chief medical adviser stated -
"The crisis is to last until spring 2021 and could see 7.9m hospitalised"
4 in 5 people 'are expected' to contract the virus
which means Prof Whitty’s mortality rate of 0.6% equates to 318,660 deaths
The mortality rate is now closer to 2% so this figure could be tripled
This is not acceptable
Test the UK with immediate effect
attributes.background:
We have the right to know if we have Covid19 and at risk of infecting others
Government must end all speculation by setting a budget for production of mass testing kits to be given to everyone
Results must be used for analysis & data should be used to isolate anyone infected for 14 days

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301354

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: 

https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: 

https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
